meanings.sent1: The mayor will proclaim the new law tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The president will proclaim the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to proclaim its ownership of the house keys.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to proclaim the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm's roar seemed to proclaim its power over the land.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will proclaim the test results to the class.
meanings.sent2: The town crier would proclaim important news in the square.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to proclaim its hunger by knocking over its food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the flowers seemed to proclaim the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The loud music seemed to proclaim the excitement of the party.

meanings.sent1: The poet will proclaim the beauty of nature in his new poem.
meanings.sent2: The fans will proclaim their love for the singer at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to proclaim its joy by wagging its tail vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow seemed to proclaim the wonder of the natural world.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display seemed to proclaim the celebration in the sky.
